active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the implications of a failed certificate signature verification during a TLS handshake. What real-world attacks (e.g., rogue CA scenarios) could exploit this, and how do standards like RFC 5280 mitigate them? Reference voter-noted misconceptions like confusing signature verification with encryption.
